intro: Heterandra, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. Heterandra species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
